problem:
Let $a,$ $b,$ $c,$ $p,$ $q,$ and $r$ be real numbers such that
\[ egin{vmatrix} p & b & c \ a & q & c \ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]Assuming that $a 
eq p,$ $b 
eq q,$ and $c 
eq r,$ find the value of $ rac{p}{p - a} +  rac{q}{q - b} +  rac{r}{r - c}.$
solution:
Expanding the determinant, we get
\begin{align*}
\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} &= p \begin{vmatrix} q & c \\ b & r \end{vmatrix} - b \begin{vmatrix} a & c \\ a & r \end{vmatrix} + c \begin{vmatrix} a & q \\ a & b \end{vmatrix} \\
&= p(qr - bc) - b(ar - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\
&= pqr - bpc - abr + abc + abc - acq \\
&= 2abc - abr - acq - bcp + pqr.
\end{align*}Let $x = p - a,$ $y = q - b,$ and $z = r - c.$  Then $p = a + x,$ $q = b + y,$ and $r = c + z.$  Substituting, we get
\[2abc - ab(c + z) - ac(b + y) - bc(a + x) + (a + x)(b + y)(c + z) = 0.\]This simplifies to $ayz + bxz + cxy + xyz = 0.$

Then
\begin{align*}
\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} &= \frac{a + x}{x} + \frac{b + y}{y} + \frac{c + z}{z} \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + 1 + \frac{b}{y} + 1 + \frac{c}{z} + 1 \\
&= \frac{a}{x} + \frac{b}{y} + \frac{c}{z} + 3 \\
&= \frac{ayz + bxz + cxy}{xyz} +  3 \\
&= \frac{-xyz}{xyz} + 3 = \boxed{2}.
\end{align*}
model_solution:
Step 1:  We are given a determinant of a 3x3 matrix and are asked to find the value of an expression involving the elements of the matrix.
The given determinant can be expanded as follows:
\[\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq)\]
Step 2:  We can simplify this expression by expanding and rearranging the terms.
Step 3:  The given determinant equals 0, so we can set the expression equal to 0 and solve for the elements of the matrix.
Step 4:  We can then use these expressions to find the value of the given expression involving the elements of the matrix.
Step 5:  This involves substituting the expressions for p, q, and r into the given expression and simplifying.

$\begin{aligned} 0 &= p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\ &= (pq - pb)r - (pc - ac)b + abc - aqc \\ &= (pq - pb)r + abc -
$p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq) = 0$
$(pq - pb)r + abc - aqc - (pc - ac)b = 0$
$(p - a)cr + abc - aqc - (p - a)cb = 0$
$cr(p - a) + abc - aqc - (p - a)cb = 0$
$cr(p - a) - cb(p - a) + abc - aqc = 0$
$(p - a)(cr - cb) + abc - aqc = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b)) + abc - aqc = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b)) + c(ab - aq) = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b)) - c(aq - ab) = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b) - (a(q - b))) = 0$
$(p - a)(cr - cb - aq + ab) = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b) - a(q - b)) = 0$
$(p - a)((c - a)(r - b)) = 0$
$(p - a)((c - a)(r - b)) = 0$
Therefore, $p = a$ or $c = r$ or $q = b.$
Since $a \neq p,$ $b \neq q,$
Since $c \neq r$, we have $p = a$ or $q = b$.

$\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= \frac{a}{a - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= 0 + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$\frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} = \frac{q(r - c) + r(q - b)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{q(r - c) + r(q - b)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{qr - qc + rq - rb}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{2qr - (q + r)(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{2qr - (q + r)(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{2qr - qb - qc - rb - rc}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{2qr - qb - qc - rb - rc}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{2qr - q(b + c) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2qr - q(b + c)) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(q - b) + r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(q - b) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$

$p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq) = 0$
$(pq - pb)r + abc - aqc - (pc - ac)b = 0$

$(p - a)((c - a)(r - b)) = 0$
Therefore, $p = a$ or $c = r$ or $q = b.$
Since $a \neq p,$ $b \neq q,$

$\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= \frac{a}{a - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= 0 + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$\frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} = \frac{q(r - c) + r(q - b)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{q(r - c) + r(q - b)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{qr - qc + rq - rb}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{2qr - (q + r)(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{2qr - (q + r)(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{2qr - qb - qc - rb - rc}{(q - b)(r - c)}$

$\frac{2qr - qb - qc - rb - rc}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{2qr - q(b + c) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2qr - q(b + c)) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$

$\frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(q - b) + r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(q - b) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
full_steps:
Step 1:  We are given a determinant of a 3x3 matrix and are asked to find the value of an expression involving the elements of the matrix.
The given determinant can be expanded as follows:
\[\begin{vmatrix} p & b & c \\ a & q & c \\ a & b & r \end{vmatrix} = p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq)\]
Step 2:  We can simplify this expression by expanding and rearranging the terms.
Step 3:  The given determinant equals 0, so we can set the expression equal to 0 and solve for the elements of the matrix.
Step 4:  We can then use these expressions to find the value of the given expression involving the elements of the matrix.
Step 5:  This involves substituting the expressions for p, q, and r into the given expression and simplifying.

$\begin{aligned} 0 &= p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq) \\ &= (pq - pb)r - (pc - ac)b + abc - aqc \\ &= (pq - pb)r + abc -

$p(qr - bc) - b(rc - ac) + c(ab - aq) = 0$
$(pq - pb)r + abc - aqc - (pc - ac)b = 0$
$(p - a)cr + abc - aqc - (p - a)cb = 0$

$cr(p - a) + abc - aqc - (p - a)cb = 0$
$cr(p - a) - cb(p - a) + abc - aqc = 0$
$(p - a)(cr - cb) + abc - aqc = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b)) + abc - aqc = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b)) + c(ab - aq) = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b)) - c(aq - ab) = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b) - (a(q - b))) = 0$
$(p - a)(cr - cb - aq + ab) = 0$
$(p - a)(c(r - b) - a(q - b)) = 0$
$(p - a)((c - a)(r - b)) = 0$
$(p - a)((c - a)(r - b)) = 0$
Therefore, $p = a$ or $c = r$ or $q = b.$
Since $a \neq p,$ $b \neq q,$

Since $c \neq r$, we have $p = a$ or $q = b$.

$\frac{p}{p - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= \frac{a}{a - a} + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= 0 + \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$= \frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c}$
$\frac{q}{q - b} + \frac{r}{r - c} = \frac{q(r - c) + r(q - b)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{q(r - c) + r(q - b)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{qr - qc + rq - rb}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{2qr - (q + r)(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{2qr - (q + r)(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{2qr - qb - qc - rb - rc}{(q - b)(r - c)}$

$\frac{2qr - qb - qc - rb - rc}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{2qr - q(b + c) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2qr - q(b + c)) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$\frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$

$\frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)} = \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q}{(q - b)(r - c)} - \frac{r(q - b) + r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
$= \frac{(2r - b - c)q - r(q - b) - r(b + c)}{(q - b)(r - c)}$
